description: Sockpuppet personalities can now be renamed and duplicated, as they could before r31.0
Designer will no longer occasionally report an error when generating the user-readable name of a stream or workload while using RenderStream
Starter will now launch successfully on machines with Windows 11 update KB5074105
When saving a section of a Track as a new Track Designer will no longer behave unexpectedly
Arrowed content in to Blur Layers using the Mask Blend Mode will now animate correctly, as it did before r31.0
Fields in Layers that are expression controlled and linked to a field in a Layer controlled by Sockpuppet now update correctly as they did before r31.0
Rolling back an object in Designer now correctly allows the user to select versions of that object from History files, as it did before r30.6
Fields in Notch, RenderStream and RenderStream Local layers that have been removed from the asset after keyframes were added to them no longer display Keyframe indicators on the Track
Designer will now run more smoothly on Actors while ingesting new media
CTRL + UP ARROW and CTRL + DOWN ARROW now jump to the top or bottom of the Cue List

The Remove Media API endpoints now only act on media in the Disguise-controlled media paths:

projects
rs-assets
rs-engine

You can now reference these special keys in your API calls to auto-resolve these paths: {projects}, {rs-assets} and {rs-engine}
Usage statistics are now anonymised on the client-side not the host-side
Prediction on incoming tracking data now works properly on actors

The execute python API now allows users to get basic information about internal Designer resources and their UIDs, as well as other non-trivial objects (like vectors) by returning them from your python script
Receiving OSC messages is now slightly more performant
We now provide a range of OCIO configs that are ACES 2.0 compliant so if you want to use ACES 2.0 you can now do so in OCIO mode
The /transport/annotations API endpoint response now returns the fade time in the response
We’ve added a new api/transport/cues API endpoint where you can send a mixed-list of tags, notes and cues in the same format as the api/transport/annotations API endpoint
Users can now disable or enable verbose UDP message printing for UDP devices
Users can now optionally manually configure which machines render which channels with RenderStream Local using the Render Nodes list
Users can now remotely create project and system diagnostics via the  system/createsystemdiagnostics and system/createprojectdiagnostics API endpoints
Diagnostics produced on machines where the username contains certain unicode characters now correctly include all debugging information
Navigating the track is now more performant in projects with many many layers
d3service now utilises a much lower amount of CPU resource
Enabling OCIO mode is now more performant
IP-VFC cards in understudies no longer inherit the Multi-cast IP addresses of the machines that they are taking over from during failover
Designer plugins now correctly react to monitor DPI scale
SDI VFCs in quad mode no longer default incorrectly in size to 3840x2160
The Live Update API is now more performant when given a target update frequency
Depth Map Mesh assets now always fit within the layer widget thumbnail area on lower DPI displays
The Live Update API can now set string type values
Closing and opening a project where virtual feed heads have been configured now correctly persists their resolution and does not wrongly default to 4096x2160
Colour Properties on layers in OCIO mode are now correctly enabled every time OCIO is enabled
Omnical Point Cloud visualisation modes: Inlier score and Filtered only now correctly show inliers
Designer is now slightly more performant when processing Transport Commands, especially Timecode Transport Commands
The ITU-R BT.1886 Gamma curve is now correctly applied as an input transform for video clips when in Gamma colour management mode
The Live Update API now correctly updates deeply nested fields in multi-machine sessions
The non-functional “Get your assets” button has been removed from d3 Manager
Designer will now more reliably report the license state of Mellanox NICs in Disguise Servers
Layer names now correctly show up on exported layers again

Updating the Nvidia Driver on your laptop above 581 will now no longer cause all RenderStream compressed receiving and sending to fail. We still do not recommend that users update drivers outside of the OS Images Disguise provides, but this should make working on laptops easier
Designer will no longer occasionally CTD when scrubbing through many audio layers when few audio output channels are configured
VX 4 and VX 4N machines will no longer erroneously report that their Deltacast Drivers are out of date when they are not
OSC expressions no longer require array indexing for non-array OSC values
Projects with a Track Jump module that references a tag will no longer briefly hang before closing
Ask AId3n plugin now works properly again
Renderstream Remote Text Parameters can now be patched to Sockpuppet again
Renderstream will no longer intermittently fail to launch the first time an Render node is booted
Keyframe snapping at certain zoom levels is now more consistent
Machines with HDMI Capture cared (EX 3+ and EX 2C) no longer require the enableHDMICapture option switch to be set to enable HDMI capture
Deleting a RenderStream Local layer while it is running will no longer result in an Access Violation
Designer now produces more detailed debugging information for a range of small Designer utility processes
Sockpuppet layers with missing media in their banks now display useful tooltips about where the content is missing even if the layers extend beyond the extent of the GUI
Jumping in to a video layer that has a video keyframe before the start of the layer now correctly treats the keyframe as starting at the layer start
Opening a project via d3Manager will no longer fail to open projects in rare conditions where user permissions are limited on laptops
Designer now correctly composes multiple layers in Mask blend modes together like it did before r31.1
Removing and re-adding a device to the devices list no longer incorrectly reports spurious errors
Sending media remove requests via the remove media API will now always correctly remove the media even if Designer is operating under heavy load
Remote transports that are engaged when they are removed from the remote transport list are now correctly disabled and no longer respond to transport commands
You can no longer add new points by clicking on a vertex in “Line Up Points” mode when using QuickCal
Writing feed movies now always starts with the playhead at the start of the selected area
Removing the director from the d3NetManager of an actor will no longer cause the actor to hang indefinitely
The Provision Media API endpoint now responds with the correct values for mediaPath and localPath
Alembic meshes now load with everything calculated correctly before they are animated
The orthographic camera render mode works again
RenderStream local now correctly displays the graphs for texture parameters in the advanced debugging widget
Designer will now log more information to the console about certain rendering errors for faster debugging
Advanced Machine Settings now appear correctly no matter which tab you type them under, as it did before r32.2
Media Remove API now supports removing files with upper cased names, as it did before r32.2
Task status API now always report 100% progress on task completion
Media Remove API now supports removing entire folders
Proxy files created by the Designer proxy maker are automatically detected, as it did before r30.7
QSDI VFC cards now always report the correct total resolution
Clicking on the space widget no longer fills up the undo system with undo operations that do nothing
Missing media Layer highlighting will now be more accurate
Moving machines in and out of session and changing machine roles while ingesting media can no longer very occasionally lead Designer to CTD
Designer now loads all FBX Skeletons with bones correctly regardless of the coordinate space of the bones in the FBX file
The /service/media/remove API endpoint will now correctly work after Designer has been closed

Using the /service/media/provision API endpoint with a mediaPath field for a file that does not exist on disk will now report “Failed” rather than “Succeeded” when subscribed to the Task Status Streaming API
d3service will now set Nvidia Power management mode to Prefer Maximum Performance on GX 3+ machines to improve FPS reporting and playback
Multi-editing in the Feed view now correctly shows output heads of EX range machines
1x 4K DCI HDMI 2.0 capture (HDMI connector)

2x 12G SDI inputs via Ports A and C (HD-BNC connector), or 4x 3G SDI inputs (HD-BNC connector)
That means the EX 2c can support simultaneously:
1x 4K DCI HDMI 2.0 capture (HDMI connector)

1x 12G SDI inputs via Port A (HD-BNC connector), or 4x 3G SDI inputs (HD-BNC connector)
or

2x 12G SDI inputs via Ports A and C (HD-BNC connector)
Note that to unlock this feature you will need to:
Use r32.2 and above
Enable the option switch enableHDMICapture

Use the appropriate 25Q3 OS image for the relevant server as outlined here
There are new Layer, Mesh and Mapping types which allow users to apply a Depth Video to meshes providing improved parallax effects in moving camera scenarios. This also integrates natively with 2.5D workflows. You can find more information about these new workflows here.
Depth Video Layer
Depth Map Mesh
Sockpuppet Personalities can now be exported as GDTF that can be read by GrandMA3. We have removed the ability to export MA2 XML formats as this seemed to be used exclusively for converting to GDTF.
You can read more about how this feature works here.
Spatial and Colour Calibration processes are now more performant and less likely to drop frames potentially causing failed calibrations
Designer now supports additional verbose logging option switches for faster debugging of prefetch issues
The timeline is now highlighted where Cues, Notes and Tags will be dropped on the timeline to add clarity when they are dragged

When using a VR set to previsualise the scene you can now set a User Parent field which allows for the VR user to be the child of another stage object. You can read more about this new field here.

There is also a new option switch enableNullVRDriver which allows the user to use the Steam VR “null” driver for testing

Blackmagic Video Hub Matrixes can now we set to either 3G and 12G and will automatically update their delays appropriately, thereby removing the need to set blackMagicMatrixSendDelay manually. As a result this option switch has been deprecated
Designer now supports OCIO v2.5. You can read more about OCIO v2.5 compatibility here
The api/service/media/remove endpoint will now unlock and remove the media specified even while Designer is running
We now have a new Fisheye Mapping for simulating the effect of a hemispherical lens
The Generate Content Table button will now properly show the correct content version even if a frame replacement from a newer version is in use
Timeline zoom levels are now user-configurable so you can configure which zoom levels you would like to jump between in your project. You can read about how to configure this here
New tooltips have been added to the Observations Visualiser Control widget
The Labels option in the Observations Visualiser Control widget is now a tick-box instead of a number
Designer will now not allow the user to create invalid EX/VX/GX machine configurations in d3net Manager which would only report errors after their creation anyway
Understudies with no valid targets are now helpfully highlighted orange in the d3Net Manager UI
Cues, Notes and Tags used in the Track Jump Layer that are deleted will no longer silently stop working in the layer. Instead a useful notification is reported

The Global Enter keybind now will always toggle playback on the timeline and to select an option using the keyboard the user will instead use CTRL + Enter
We’ve also made a range of improvements to our Plugins API:
Transport Commands can now be created via the Designer Plugins API
It is now possible to get elapsed and remaining time left on layers from the Designer Plugins API new easily
The Designer Plugins API now has better controls for Layer Stacks
The Designer Plugins API now allows you to remove and add time from tracks
The Designer Plugins API now has better information about object Categories
The Screen fill factor setting for XR Colour Calibration now works correctly again
Multi-Dragging Notes/Tags/Cues/Sections no longer “Slide off” features that they should not
When aborting a Colour Calibration in Write or Read mode Designer will no longer report a spurious error
Scene origin in 2.5D layers now correctly works when the 2.5D asset is rendered in a Stage Render Layer

Custom ranges, default values, and step sizes in Sockpuppet personalities configured ie from projects created in versions below r31.0 will now correctly retain these changes when updating to r32.2 and above
The Sockpuppet Personality GUI now allows multi-select editing again
Manually adding assets to a 2.5D Layer no longer reports spurious errors
Video with embedded audio in a quantised track with section breaks that cross the layer the video is sequenced in will no longer playback stuttery audio
You can now de-isolate isolated Sockpuppet fields properly after closing and re-opening a Sockpuppet widget editor
Sockpuppet Patched fields isolate/de-isolate button now automatically changes it’s text based on whether the field is isolated or not
d3Manager now has improved logging for better diagnostics
The Floor mesh is no longer rendered on top of transparent screens even if the content on the screens is fully opaque
HD ProRes video performance for the GX 3+ has been greatly improved. The updated performance results are available here
Files without the OCIO extension placed in the OCIO folder are no longer wrongly loaded as (broken) OCIO configurations
Previews of 2.5D assets in “Metric” measurement mode no longer appear extremely small
The “Maximum Depth” field in 2.5D assets now scales content correctly
Understudy target filtering now correctly includes X1 machines
Audio prefetch requests are no longer included in Video delivery prefetch graphs
Selecting audio for the Tennis Layer now correctly displays the file extension in the Audio File selector
EX 2C machines can now correctly be set as as Non-Dedicated Director with VX4+ Actors
Duplicating time on timelines with many layers will no longer sometimes lead to a long hang
Designer will no longer fail to launch properly when loading specific Skeletal Mesh rigged FBX files
Audio Layers with At Endpoint set to Loop now loops correctly even when the timeline Playhead holds on a section break
Projects upgraded from before r31.3.2 now correctly save Cue positions for all cues after project restarts
Using a Mesh or Perspective Mapping in an RS layer using a UE workload no longer has a negative impact on workload performance
ST 2110 capture of 1080p YCbCr signals no longer results in visual striping along the left side of the image
ST 2110 video capture latency has been significantly reduced and now has parity with SDI video capture solutions on Disguise servers

The IP Address of the Local Machine in the Machine editor no longer always displays 127.0.0.1 and instead shows the actual d3Net IP Address.
lastUpdated: 2025-12-10
Selecting a MIDI device in an MTC layer no longer reports an error on X1 machines
Video is now correctly prefetched before the start of a layer which should stop rogue black flashes when jumping the playhead or playing in to layers

A new option “No Clamp” has been added to the Tonemapping field of the Colour Profile object which allows for users to disable clamping in the colour pipeline when using Gamma Space colour management. Please note that if you set this option in r32.1.3 and roll back to r32.1.2 or below it will revert to “Filmic Grain” in the tone mapping field and you will need to manually set it again upon rolling back up to r32.1.3 or above
Telnet transport commands now respect the transition field again and will fade over that transition period instead of snapping

RenderStream, Video and Legacy Video layers with certain fields patched to Sockpuppet will no longer fail to populate their Sockpuppet personality editors properly when upgraded from older versions of Designer before r23.1
Using the POST /media/provision API now returns a correct matching UID so you can subscribe to the task progress
Designer now reads OSC messages even when the address omits the null-terminator (which is non-standard OSC)
Sending an MSC command to jump to a cue that does not exist will no longer report an unhelpful error
Certain API endpoints will no longer fail if there is a mixture of d3 machines from before and after r26.0 on the network
HDR Textures sent as texture parameters to RS workloads where the working space is ACEScg are no longer clipped and now properly reflect the full HDR range
Selecting a MIDI device in an MTC layer no longer reports an error on X1 machines
Video is now correctly prefetched before the start of a layer which should stop rogue black flashes when jumping the playhead or playing in to layers

A new option “No Clamp” has been added to the Tonemapping field of the Colour Profile object which allows for users to disable clamping in the colour pipeline when using Gamma Space colour management. Please note that if you set this option in r32.1.3 and roll back to r32.1.2 or below it will revert to “Filmic Grain” in the tone mapping field and you will need to manually set it again upon rolling back up to r32.1.3 or above
Telnet transport commands now respect the transition field again and will fade over that transition period instead of snapping

RenderStream, Video and Legacy Video layers with certain fields patched to Sockpuppet will no longer fail to populate their Sockpuppet personality editors properly when upgraded from older versions of Designer before r23.1
Using the POST /media/provision API now returns a correct matching UID so you can subscribe to the task progress
Designer now reads OSC messages even when the address omits the null-terminator (which is non-standard OSC)
Sending an MSC command to jump to a cue that does not exist will no longer report an unhelpful error
Certain API endpoints will no longer fail if there is a mixture of d3 machines from before and after r26.0 on the network
HDR Textures sent as texture parameters to RS workloads where the working space is ACEScg are no longer clipped and now properly reflect the full HDR range
Track editing performance has generally been improved when working with many layers
Newly ingested Videoclips are now correctly returned by the v1/resources API endpoint
Keyframes now correctly snap to bar intervals at all zoom levels
The Task Status API endpoint now correctly reports about tasks when they are Queued and Started
Creating a virtual GX 3+ machine during pre-programming now properly lists the correct capture formats
Cue positions now always stay where the ought to be visually when duplicating Layers
Warped projectors on remote machines no longer are displayed on Editors and Directors as all black
Importing CUE tables now leaves user-defined cross-fades intact
RenderStream Local workloads using DX 12 and mesh mappings now look correct
Subscribing to the Live Update API no longer blocks users from undoing user actions
Creating a new track with the track widget closed will no longer report an error
The GX 3+ now has partial IP-VFC card support for specific output formats. You can find these formats listed here
When a Video Clip has Frame Blending enabled and a non-zero Loop-In Frame, video playback now correctly loops back to the Loop-In Frame, not the first frame of the Video Clip
RenderStream receivers no longer send redundant network messages to other receivers, greatly reducing overall network traffic over d3net when running RenderStream with many actors
Changing the Video Clip of a Sockpuppet Video Layer when Brightness is 0 no longer starts playback automatically in the background. Instead, playback now starts only when Brightness is raised above 0

When a DMX signal is lost for more than 10 seconds, DMX event transport no longer reverts to 0, which could cause unexpected behaviour e.g. jumping back to CUE 0.

Triggering failover via DMX is also modified to now only work when the value is first set to 0 and then set to the configured value for failover triggering. e.g. if you need to send 20 for failover you will need to set the channel to 0, then 20. If you sent it from 0 to 10 and then to 20, Failover will not trigger
Creating new tracks no longer erroneously adds broken Cues to the track list

Sockpuppeted effects layers no longer duplicate the content source texture property in their personality on project restart. This restores behaviour before r31.0.

For customers with projects that have already experienced this problem, you can find instructions for how to reset your personalities to their defaults here
OSC drivers (used for e.g. tracking encoders) now support parsing messages without trailing slashes again
Setting the output mode to Hold no longer flickers between two frames, but outputs the last frame properly. This restores behaviour prior to r31.2
Opening projects with many tags and cues is no longer very slow
All user-configurations of Sockpuppet properties (like custom names etc.) now persist properly through project restarts

Notch blocks without default values set in Notch now set sensible default values in Designer instead of failing to launch properly.

Enum values will select the 1st enum.
Numerical fields will select the mid value between the min and max.
Colours default to black with alpha 1
The api/session/sockpuppet/patches API now correctly only returns fields patched on the layer
DSE blending now works properly in all scenarios again
When run on Windows 11 Disguise servers, the Designer installer will now disable secure-boot in Windows Task Scheduler to stop SecureBootEncodeUEFI.exe from taking focus
The Designer installer now warns if it detects UE5 and TouchDesigner running in addition to Unity and UE4
Switching Colour space from OCIO back to Gamma after setting OCIO parameters no longer results in console spam
CodeMeter Runtime included in the Designer installer has been updated to v8.40. This change supports Notch blocks exported in Notch 1.0.0.041 and newer

Under light workloads, video inputs used in video layers are now delayed by one frame to ensure smooth video playback. This functionality can be disabled by setting the option switch smoothVideoInputFramesDelay to -1. This does not affect XR workflows

Designer now supports a new API session endpoint api/session/transport/transports, which lists all the MultiTransports and normal Transports in a single response. For more details, please refer to the Developer Documentation
Users can now monitor the ongoing statuses of their Media Provisioning Tasks by subscribing to the Task Status API. For more details, please refer to the Developer Documentation
In a 2.5D layer, the boolean field “Sync To Timeline” is now renamed to “Mode”. The two available options are “Normal” and “Locked”. This makes it consistent with other layers in Designer
The default point cloud visualisation mode for Omnical is now “ProjectorReprojError” instead of “Tolerance”, as it is more useful for users

Designer now has a new Python object SequencedValue, which can be obtained through the new Python method FieldSequence.getSequencedValue(). This object contains information about the sequenced value at a given time, and its neighbouring left and right keyframes. For more details, please refer to the Developer Documentation
Designer now has new Python methods for the VideoClip class: hasAudio(), enabledVersion, proxyInfo. For more details, please refer to the Developer Documentation
The buttons in the Media Ingestion History widget now have more descriptive and useful tooltips

The Layer.module field accessible in the python API is now restricted so it cannot be accessed directly by plugin developers. This is because it doesn’t behave the way people expect and is not required for plugins
Last updated: Feb 18, 2026
Playing back video very slowly with frame blending is now smoother
Designer will no longer hang for long periods when inserting time on the timeline in projects with hundreds of layers on the same track

Selecting Show History on a project folder in Manager will now always display a consistent list of versions in the correct order, and opening a project from this menu will open the project in the installed version of Designer
The pyi stub file now has the correct return types for several methods of ResourceManager
Notes can now be deleted again by clearing the text field for the note and pressing OK

Python method Track.splitSectionAtBeat() now accepts an optional second argument for specifying the transition setting for the new section, as it did before r31.3. For more information about the Track class, please refer to the Developer Documentation
When switching from a track with a geometric mapping to another track without geometric mappings, Designer no longer reports an Access Violation error. This restores the behaviour prior to r31.3.1
DMX Channels in the DMXPatch Editor can now be reordered to lower Channels again, as they could be before r31.0. Once reordered, the properties are correctly editable
Editing Cues on duplicated tracks will no longer be reflected across other duplicated copies, as it was before r31.3
VX 1 and VX 4/4n/4+ servers with Matrox capture cards will no longer crash to desktop when capturing using certain input ports, as it did before r31.0.3

Designer will no longer occasionally hang indefinitely on shutdown from handling API requests
Note
Frequent polling of API endpoints is strongly discouraged. It can lead to reduced system performance. To receive real-time updates, we recommend using the Live Update API for streaming data from Designer. This ensures your app always has the latest data without extra overhead. A more detailed explanation can be found under Recommended: Use Live Update Instead of Polling REST APIs on the Developer Portal.
Duplicating time at the end of a track no longer reports a spurious error, as it did before r30.8
Inserting time in Layers, sections and audio and Layers and sections only modes no longer leaves section breaks behind, as it did before r31.3

HTTP Sockpuppet listPatches endpoint no longer returns an empty ‘type’ and stringValue. The type is now ‘string’, and if a value had been previously sent via the ‘live’ endpoint, stringValue now displays the last value sent. This restores the behaviour before r31.0
RenderStream workloads using Texture Parameters no longer reports a spurious “RenderStream Send Failed” error
The api/service/project/startlocalproject API endpoint can now accept the projectPath parameter as either a relative or absolute path, rather than just a relative path
Designer no longer fails to start up on GX 1 and GX 2 servers with a “Error calling ‘pOutput->QueryInterface<IDXGIOutput6>(&output6)’” error message, as it did before r31.2
On Windows platforms older than version 1809, calling the /api/service/media/provision API endpoint no longer fails to create hard links between files downloaded from the same source
Layers starting and ending on a section break no longer have their content duplicated across multiple sections in the generated content table

Applying feed settings with an IP-VFC card no longer fails when the card isn’t generating a genlock signal (e.g., due to misconfiguration or missing external genlock). This restores the behaviour prior to r31.2
Designer no longer blocks users from adding LumaKey and Placeholder video inputs when all the physical video inputs are also being used
The api/service/system/projects API endpoint now correctly handles Designer versions that match the rXX.Y-name custom branch format, and the ancient release_XX format
CTRL+1 - open the menu and focus on the Timecode Tag
CTRL+2 - open the menu and focus on the DMX Tag
CTRL+3 - open the menu and focus on the MIDI Tag

CTRL+T - open the menu and focus on the last-editted Tag type
Individual Tags and Notes can be moved along the Track as usual by holding Alt and Left Mouse Button Dragging. Dragging in this mode allows users to merge Notes and Tags onto existing Cues. Holding Ctrl and Alt and Left Mouse Button Dragging now moves an entire Cue along the Track. Cues cannot be merged in this mode. Instead, it will slip to the next available beat.
For users of the Python API, the Track object now has additional methods, e.g.
cueBeats - returns an array of beats where Cues are placed
cueAtBeat - returns a Cue object located at the specified beat

setNoteAtBeat - sets the Note at the specified beat
For more details on the new Track methods, please see the Developer guide.
The Cue List has been modified to accommodate multiple Tags on the same beat. Empty Note and Tags columns are automatically hidden in the Cue List for performance reasons. Users can now create Notes and Tags directly from the Cue List, as long as the relevant column is visible. Inserting a blank string in the Note or Tags columns will automatically delete it from the Track.
The Track Jump module has been modified so it no longer references a Section index, but rather a Cue in the selected track. The reference is preserved when Sections are added or removed, or if the selected Section break is moved around on the Track.
A new api/service/media/list API endpoint gets a list of files under the requested directory
Enable guisystem.selectedlayers in Python API
Tooltip added for OmniCal Calibration
The ‘Reconfigure Workload’ button in the RenderStream layer now has a more descriptive tooltip
Python API users can create parameters for Open Layers without needing a Playhead over the Layer
v1 API ‘list Resources’ endpoint no longer returns an empty response, as it did before r31.2
A machine not connected to the internet will no longer disable API functionality, as it did before r31.1
The ‘Find/Replace Usage’ button no longer reports an error and fails to open the usages menu, as it did before r31.1
Arrowing into a UVLookUp layer no longer reports errors, as it did before r21.3.2
The Designer installer now warns users about requiring CodeMeter Runtime, if it is not already installed, before continuing with installation
When using the Python Track.makeArrow function to create an arrow between two layers not under the current Playhead, Designer will no longer report an error
When removing time at the end of a track, Designer will no longer report a spurious error
Cameras no longer stutter in their movement when the parent prop is animated, as they did before r31.0.3
Servers with IP-VFC cards in PTP Sync Mode no longer report errors when changing the PTP profile, as they did before r30.7.2
Using Border Expansion with Spherical Mapping no longer distorts the final results with certain meshes
The Python API method overlayMessage no longer misses some of its parameter names
Tracked points in SkeletalPointTrackingSource are now bound between settable upper and lower limits
The Chromium Embedded Framework (CEF) package, used for the web layer and plugins, has been updated to version 137.0.19, which contains Chromium version 137.0.7151.121
Notch layers now have Padding X and Padding Y fields to help remove screen-space effects e.g. vignettes. See the Notch layer page for more details
In Stage Render Settings for a Camera, users now have the option to hide skeletons on stage. See the Stage Render Settings page for more details
Projector objects now have a mask field to apply a mask to the projection surface(s) it hits. See the Editing Projectors page for more details
IP-VFC cards will now behave more reliably on machine boot when they are configured to use external Genlock but are currently not receiving an external Genlock signal
Sockpuppet patch widgets are now titled with their owning layer or object, and the name of the patch, instead of generic names ‘DMX Patch’ or ‘OSC Patch’
Users are now notified when there is a DMX channel conflict without needing to open the DMX Patch Assignment Widget
Track zoom in/out buttons now have tooltips explaining the keyboard shortcuts to perform the same actions

Luma-Matte and Inverse-Luma-Matte blend modes, added in r31.1, are now moved to the end of the list of blend modes, which restores the original order of modes for DMX personalities. See the Blend Mode page for more details
Skeletons now stay in place when individual points rejoin after losing tracking
RenderStreamLocal now supports Front Plate mappings
Skeleton points no longer suffer from gimbal lock when objects rotate through 360 degrees
Multi-machine sessions now are better synchronised when the director is not genlocked
Machines that failed to join a session no longer spam RenderStream error notifications
Changing a project between 8- to 10-bit output modes will now wait to configure the GPU with the correct bit-depth until feed settings are applied (like all other feed settings)
RenderStream workloads no longer reports spurious errors when removing channels or changing mappings
SkeletalPointTrackingSource tracking is no longer influenced by the initial pose of the Skeleton
Tooltips for Fade Up/Fade Down/Hold are now corrected
Feed rectangle tooltips are now corrected
The EULA for Pro and Starter installers are now the same
Layers that are resized from the left will now properly report their content in Exported Content Tables
Designer will no longer fail to import FBX meshes with null attributes, and will instead ignore the null attributes
In performance-limited situations, XR colour calibration will no longer occassionally fail to capture all colours
Mesh Mapping with ‘Tiles’ Splitting Type correctly warps DX12 RenderStream workloads again, as it did before r31.0
The first VFC output of a VX4+ will no longer fail to framelock with the other outputs
Viewing a video layer patch assignment in a Patch List or Global Patch List view will no longer report a spurious error
Director machines running large projects, especially with lots of projectors, will no longer suffer from performance issues
Designer APIs are now case-insensitive to input option names, as they were before r30.8
SkeletalPointTrackingSource now filters out duplicated tracking points for improved tracking stability
SkeletalPointTrackingSource now correctly handle non-zero root node offsets from the FBX mesh
Now RenderStream Projects network share settings will always be configured upon installation of Designer, same as the d3 Projects network share
Designer plugins can now check if a user is logged in to Designer Cloud via d3Manager
Layers now have a “Luma Matte Mask” Blend Mode. You can read about how to use it here
2.5D layers now can be played back locked to the timeline
ReferencePoints manager now includes a list of TrackedPoints
The default step value boxes in SkeletalPointTrackingSource is now 0.1
The cue list widget now retains it’s size after closing and reopening the widget
The Media Provisioning API now only accepts absolute paths for file provisioning and removal
Media Provisioning API endpoints can now be given a list of paths to files to provision and/or remove instead of accepting only 1 path at a time
The RenderStream Latency graph now has more details about what in the render pipeline is causing the latency
Designer will no longer occasionally experience video capture drops in rare circumstances
Upgrading specific projects with specific expressions past r31.0 will no longer crash with an ACCESS_VIOLATION
Remote textures shared with UE over RenderStream when UE is set to have a working colour space of ACEScg now have the correct colour response throughout the render pipeline
SDP files placed in SDPFile folder now create an IP video input automatically
Modifications to IP video capture streams now persist between reboots on Actors properly
Remote textures shared over RenderStream whose sources are arrowed layers where the content in that arrowed layer is controlled by an indirection now respond properly to indirection changes
Sending media management API calls in very quick succession will no longer sometimes fail
Layers mapped to inactive screens but also arrowed in to layers with active screens now prefetch their content properly
Using the “Find and Remove Programs” tool in Windows now properly lists Designer as “Designer” instead of “d3”
Attempting to provision media via the Media Provisioning API using only the “transfers” element will no longer return a spurious failure message after the correct success messages
A SkeletalPoint Tracking Source can no longer be selected for non-Skeleton objects
Concurrent Media Provisioning API calls referencing the same file will no longer perform multiple unnecessary copies and will instead perform 1 copy and create multiple hard-links
Plugin and web layer logs are now more comprehensive for easier debugging
The plugin API has a new endpoint which will allow users to import .d3export files called importFromPackageName
Switching a DMX patch to output mode when some fields are toggled off will no longer produce a spurious error message
Skeleton objects can now be correctly controlled with Rigid Body Tracking Sources
The warning message triggered upon Sockpuppet personality regeneration now specifies the location of the regenerated file, enabling easier validation after an upgrade
RenderStream layers that are syncing assets will now display the status of the sync on the layer itself in the track widget
XR Tracker Delay no longer reports an error and fails to capture grid images in some circumstances
Designer will no longer very occasionally hang indefinitely when transitioning from fullscreen to windowed or leaving RenderStream layers
The Delete All Patches button in the Patch Assignment Options menu is functional again
The Track Widget is now more performant on directors, editors and understudies
The console will no longer be filled with lots of spurious messages in certain scenarios when viewing the Feed View
Opening a Sockpuppet Patch Editor for a DMX Event Transport will no longer result in the patch editor being disconnected from its parent editor
The Designer uninstaller will now correctly remove all registry keys
VX 4+ machines equipped with Matrox capture cards will no longer see that sometimes the 2E port is not synced with others when capturing 12G SDI signals
Blacks captured in HDR with ST 2110 Network Video Capture no longer display incorrectly
The XR Colour calibration widget can now correctly be opened again
Designer will no longer sometimes spuriously log errors about receiving frames while RenderStream is launching
The default DMX Event Transport channels in new projects are now 5, 6 and 7 as they were before r31.0
Designer will no longer fail to open the RenderStream asset list in rare cases where an asset is discovered but the node it was discovered from quickly disconnects from the network
After disabling the DMX Event Transport’s Output Mode command, Output Mode is now correctly manually configurable again
Muting tracked points now correctly disables them on SkeletalPointTrackingSources

SDI 1080p Level B quad link video signals coming from Blackmagic video sources no longer flicker when captured on Disguise servers equipped with Deltacast capture cards.

If the Colourimetry or Transfer Characteristic of the incoming video signal cannot be read from the signal metadata, Designer will default to Rec.709 and SDR
Designer now logs which adaptors has been set as the Preferred Sync Adaptor of a cluster pool to the console to better assist with debugging
Linking a position receiver field to an open layer no longer causes Designer to CTD
The DisplayViewTransform field in OCIO configs is now properly applied when used as an input transform
Designer will no longer perform below specification when playing back many layers of video
Project folders that have a plugins sub-folder can now be deleted properly without a permissions error
Designer will not longer report an error when the project is saved if a RenderStream receive health widget is pinned
Rendering a layer with a Mesh Projection mapping no longer causes a frame drop on the first frame of the layer
Live update will not longer regularly become blocked when doing skeleton tracking across multiple machines
Understudies no longer spuriously report that they cannot send OSC messages when using projector calibrator devices
RenderStream workloads will no longer fail to launch for all assets if a single asset with an invalid engine type is discovered on the network
Compositor frames are no longer exported at proxy resolutions
d3Manager’s feature Clear ingestion history works as expected again
Transports can no longer be Engaged/Disengaged by pressing Enter after toggling Engage/Disengage
Plugins are now available in Starter versions of Designer
We now offer an optional Colour Management (ACES & OCIO) unlock license for the EX range. You can find more information about how to buy this license by contacting the sales team
Undo will now undo and redo the creation and deletion of whole objects, not just edits to objects
During XR Colour Calibration, you can now optionally choose to pre-generate your LED screen Mask and visualise it to help with debugging
During XR Colour Calibration, old LUTs are now automatically backed up in a backup folder and can be restored by undoing the previous calibration
Expressions now support negative array indexing to index from the last element, like Python
The De-Isolate Sockpuppet toggle on Sockpuppet fields now returns the layer to the state before the field was isolated instead of simply re-patching all fields
Graph legends font size is now large enough to be seen with the naked eye

A new Zero Pose Button in the Skeleton editor, which will set all the joint poses to 0
You can visit our Developer documentation here.
Designer now responds with more useful error messages when it receives an unsupported API request
A range of improvements have been made, including the ability to subscribe to live Graph data
There is now a new API endpoint for changing the Cluster pool of a RenderStream workload
The plugin API for accessing Indirections is now simpler to use
The Designer API now accepts UIDs in both Hexadecimal and Decimal formats
A new Service API endpoint is now available for deleting media on disk
Error messages reported when Invalid Arrows are created are now more detailed
Designer now has better debug logging to detect issues with bulk modifications of QuickCal Reference Points
Designer now has more detailed and helpful error messages when Starter projects are opened in Ful  versions of Designer
Designer now has more useful error notifications of certain errors, including when meshes are missing in OmniCal environments
Designer now has more descriptive error logs in the consoles if getting or saving information about the d3Net adaptor fails. This enables quicker debugging
Using the colour checker in OCIO mode no longer erroneously reports small errors in some colour responses using the standard MacBeth ColorChecker chart
Designer will no longer sometimes CTD with an audio error after playing video with embedded audio for many hours

If the network adapter profile of a NIC is set to Public in Windows. Designer will now report a useful error when starting RenderStream, directing the user to change the setting, rather than allow the workload to sometimes get stuck on Starting

Dragging a section with a custom Fade Duration set no longer reverts the section’s Fade setting to Global
Last updated: Sep 24, 2025
Changing warp markers on a Feed Map will no longer cause excessive console logging
Starter Designer will no longer fail to launch with a missing license error
RenderStream workloads will no longer crash when reconfigured with 0 size and instead a helpful error message is displayed and the workload is not reconfigured until a valid size is set
Using Export Compositor Frame in the feed view will now always produce an image at full resolution regardless of the level of zoom in the GUI
The list of network adaptors displayed in the SMC UI will no update in realtime when adaptor settings change
Text Layers now render correctly with text with carriage return characters
Designer no longer respond to transport commands slowly when out of focus
Changes to the Offsets in a SkeletalPointTrackingSource object are now properly reflected on actor machines in real time
VideoTrigger layers patched to Sockpuppet will now properly respect the Speed field before the video is re-triggered
Using a parallel mapping with transparent content will no longer display a ghostly diagonal line across content
MIDI sliders in the Designer GUI with midi input assigned no longer move jerkily
The Readout layer now displays the correct section note when chasing timecode
Designer will no longer report a spurious error when clicking on a missing media notification
The Brightness field on the Tracking Marker layer will now correctly dim the layer
Certain cases where projects can become corrupted will no longer occur
On project close Designer will no longer throw a spurious error if a temporary file exists that begins with “d3”
Designer will no longer report an Access Violation when creating a Virtual Camera or an MR Set under certain circumstances
FBX files with embedded textures will no longer cause Designer to create a sub-folder for every embedded texture sub-folder
Video Transition layers will no longer stop playing when holding on a section break when playback speed is patched to Sockpuppet
Video layers will no longer stop playing when holding on a section break when an expression is used to control their speed
HTTP Sockpuppet API endpoints now accept either a full 64-bit integer OR a hex value for the UID of the layer you want to control
RenderStream workloads will no longer intermittently get stuck in Awaiting requests (not requested) on launch if packets are dropped on startup
Performance has generally been improved when modifying objects. (no more small hangs while editing!)
Designer will no longer report an Access Violation when creating an MR set for the first time
Intermittent video input signals on Matrox machines will no longer lead to performance stutters
Newly created reference points will now appear on the actor’s feed view immediately upon creation
Disguise servers equipped with Bluefish capture cards will no longer excessively log errors in rare scenarios when dropping frames
Designer will no longer trigger OSC events multiple times if their addresses start with the same string of characters
When transitioning in to a new section after holding at the end Designer will no longer occasionally play a single frame from the middle of the upcoming video
Video layers in quantized tracks now play back at the correct speed
In certain hardware configurations machines with a Matrox capture card will no longer intermittently drop frames on input
Specific projects will no longer report an exception on shutdown
EX range understudies can now be used to understudy an EX range Dedicated Director even if the actors are non-EX range machines without reporting an error
Receiving anomalous timecode while chasing will now never put Designer in to “Ignoring Timecode” mode
Projectors that are renamed before a machine CTDs will no longer be corrupted when the project is re-opened
EventTransportDMX Brightness is no longer sent every frame if it’s not changing
Machines that fail to properly release certain telemetry files no longer fill up their memory with temp copies of those files
The API endpoint service/project/startlocalproject will no longer fail to launch the project
The API endpoint /system/projects now correctly returns the list of projects on a system, including .d3starter projects if they are present
Large projects will no longer drop frames when jumping on the timeline under within-spec load conditions if crossfade is configured anywhere on the timeline
Projects that include certain projector calibration configurations will no longer report an ACCESS_VIOLATION on launch
Starter projects will no longer produce corrupted project files the first time they are saved. (The next time they are saved, they would save an uncorrupted file)
Very long timelines will no longer sometimes degrade in performance when jumping to certain sections
Rendering the wireframe of a mesh projection is now slightly more performant
When the Plugin Manager can’t find the project plugin folder it will no longer cause d3service to crash
The API endpoints /system/gpuoutputs and /system/vfcs now longer respond with an error
Reading a corrupted mesh file will now report a helpful error instead of potentially causing a CTD
Shift selecting nothing on timeline no longer displays a useless blank error window

Coloured Layers
Layers on the timeline and in layer stacks can now be coloured based on a range of user-definable criteria. You can read more about this feature here. There are several more improvements to the look and feel of the timeline including a new highlighting look to better distinguish selected layers. Keyframes are now also visible directly on the timeline.
Example of Coloured Layers

Sockpuppet Synchronisation
We can also now guarantee synchronisation in a Sockpuppet workflow for the first time! Now even if machines drop frames, when they recover from frame drops, Sockpuppet layers will return to an in-sync state regardless of what transport commands have been sent.

ST 2110 Network Video Capture (Prerelease)
Finally, we’re releasing our first beta test for ST 2110 network video capture! You can access this feature in Gold by turning on the option switch enableIPVideo. Please do reach out to us if you’d like to use it on a show so we can help support you and gather any feedback. You can read more about the workflow here.

X1 Support
Designer r30.8 introduces support for our new Disguise X1 USB License Key enabling users to run a single node on their own hardware provided it meets the recommended technical specification.
Read more about the Disguise X1 here.
The ColourAdjust layer now has several new fields to allow for output clamping. More information on these fields can be found here
VP and XR Colour Calibration performance has been slightly improved
The ‘About Designer Starter’ popup will now only display once on first install

Plugins opened inside Designer will default to a dark mode scheme if one is available
We’ve made a range of improvements in this release to the plugin developer experience to increase the power and usability of Designer plugins:
There is now a new plugin function available for evaluating expressions: evaluateFromString which enables expression evaluation of any string
There is now a new plugin function to access domains via domain:<type> to access things like mapped media or shadow resources
The plugins LiveUpdate API now allows users to subscribe to custom dictionaries
Plugin authors can now provide a json file to share metadata about their plugins. This can also be configured to be fully DNS-SD compliant. You can read more about how to setup this meta-data here
Designer will no longer sometimes CTD after editing lots of cameras or spatial maps after a very long time
Expressions now allow access to resources in folders and with dots in their name
Launching starter projects via the /project/startlocalproject API now always requires the user to be logged in in d3manager before launching
The MultiTransportManager now allows you to select “None” as a transport (and will no longer highlight in red if None is selected)
The Web layer now allows you to select “None” as a bookmark or command keyframe (and will no longer highlight in red if None is selected)
The control points when warping in a feed mapping now always warp the correct part of the image
Launching a Pro project with Starter via the /project/startlocalproject API now correctly transforms Pro Projects into Starter Projects (instead of failing to open the project)
It is now possible to drag the scrollbar in the plugin launcher
Plugins launched via the plugin launcher now launch close to the mouse cursor
Switching colour management modes while the colour inspector is open no longer reports notifications until the inspector is closed
Layers now properly apply the content input transform of source textures whether a texture is manually set or arrowed in to the layer
Plugin Launcher text no longer overflows if plugin names are long
Improved some logging around RenderStream workflows for quicker debugging
Running RenderStream texture parameters in OCIO mode is now slightly more performant
Designer will no longer report “No Valid d3projects folder is specified” on launch when a folder is specified
d3Manager will now correctly display the version of projects again
2x4 servers are now correctly detected as Disguise servers again
Right-clicking on a non-numeric field now correctly opens the meta field editor again
Designer installers are now ~20% smaller
RenderStream texture parameters will no longer intermittently fail with an access violation in rare circumstances
Designer will no longer drop frames when switching tracks or distributing media is very complicated projects
Users can now use dot notation to subscribe to sub-resources with the LiveUpdate API
Starter licenses will no longer occasionally fail to be installed on machines that have never had Designer installed before
Installer logs are now more detailed to help with finding and fixing errors
When installing a new version of Starter, old Starter CodeMeter containers are now correctly removed
The About Designer Starter dialogue box now correctly displays in all DPI scales
Designer uninstaller now correctly removes temp files that you don’t need any more
Stopping a RenderStream workload in a high latency environment will no longer display spurious notifications and console logging

Running Designer on a Windows 10 machine in a network where some Designer machines cannot see each other over d3net but can see each other over another network will no longer result in excessive console spam which can fill up the C drive
Designer Starter sessions now support more than 2 machines

Disguise Media Servers running Designer Starter can now correctly join sessions as Actors and Understudies. Remember, these sessions can only include other machines running Starter and all machines running Starter will output with watermarks
Opening the Plugin Launcher with no plugins installed now has a helpful link for installing new plugins
Network traffic between machines in session has been reduced slightly
Sockpuppet video layers that transition to content that is only needed by some actors no longer leave the old content in place on actors that do not need the new content
CDL objects that are locked can no longer be modified via the CDL API endpoints
Added a new Plugins method: Editor.exportResource for exporting .d3export files. You can find our extensive developer documentation for the Plugins API here
Various error messages about opening Starter and Full versions of the software are now clearer
Playing into the first VideoClip keyframe on a video layer will no longer start the video from 0
Starter can now open projects normally on machines running Windows Home
Modifying the joints of skeletons on Editor machines now correctly updates on the Director machine
Quantised timelines now respect their transport’s “On Clock Lost” setting
Installing multiple versions of Designer in the same network will no longer produce notification spam in rare circumstances
Resizing plugin windows no longer causes the content in the window to flash
Full versions of Designer can now make checkpoints again
Layers that do not require prefetching (like Control layers) will now no longer be prefetched
Ask Aid3n - Our Disguise AI workflow assistant
Disguise Cloud Media Browser - Access and download media from Disguise Drive into your d3 project

Luma AI Video Generator - Text-to-video generation that imports directly to your d3 project.
You can find detailed information on accessing, installing, and managing plugins here
Documentation of our Plugins Framework can be found here.
Plugins are not supported in the Starter version of Designer. To use plugins, ensure you have the Full (Pro) version of Designer.

We’ve made a range of improvements to expressions. You can find the extensive documentation on common datatypes, variables, string manipulation, and monitoring using custom messages.

 - A variable for “Fade up” and “Fade down” is now exposed for use with OSC Output Expressions.
 - A variable for Pre-Roll in TC Status is now exposed for use with OSC Output Expressions.
 - Float expressions in the Expressions Variable Device now have a settable min and max.
 - Expression function variables can now have parameters defined.
 - Expression variables are now re-orderable by left-click and drag.
 - Expressions now support returning an array of composite vector types. Note that to use them in a field you still need to access the individual floats. These are:

Colour
Vec2 (alias float2)
Vec3 (alias float3)
Vec4 (alias float4)


 - Expressions now have a range of string manipulation functions:

split
replace
strip
title
upper
lower
combine
When renaming a project or folder via d3manager the previous name is now editable as the starting-point for your rename
OSC Event Transports now highlight in red if no OSC device is selected
Mesh Mapping now has adjustable zNear and zFar clipping planes
Solo machines will now notify clearly that versions of Designer above r30 are not supported

Designer now sends us additional telemetry data about plugin usage. Remember, if you want to opt-out of telemetry you can do so in the installer or at any time in d3Manager by going to Help > About Manager. We still do not include whole project files or content
Web Layers interactable windows can now receive numpad events
Designer will no longer intermittently CTD after playing back video with embedded audio for a very long time
Transparent projection surfaces will no longer cast shadows on objects behind them as if they were opaque
Large list views will no longer have input boxes that can detach and float around the GUI like a ghost
Text in the feed mapping visualizer now scales correctly with DPI so it’s actually visible
Opening the metafield editor of two identical fields will no longer show the first fields metafields for the second ones
ExpressionVariables module has moved to it’s correct place under the Control header in the layers library

Opening the Colour Calibration widget will no longer automatically add a rogue MRset to the sets being calibrated. Now if there is only a single MRset associated with that calibration it will set the MRset to that one, otherwise it will leave the list un-changed
After holding at the end of a section for a while, Designer will no longer occasionally display the wrong frame of upcoming content when moving to the next section
d3service will no longer crash under rare circumstances executing tasks
Designer will no longer fail to launch on RX range machines even when they have a valid Designer or Pro license
d3Manager now highlights which projects were built with Starter and Full versions of Designer
We’ve improved the Help -> Disguise Licenses page within d3Manager to be more user friendly to view the status of all your licenses
The /status/project API endpoint now also returns whether the project is Starter or Full

We’ve added additional details to our telemetry about how users use Designer. Remember, if you want to opt-out of telemetry you can do so in the installer or at any time in d3Manager by going to Help > About Manager. We still do not include whole project files or content
VX 4+ servers will no longer struggle to maintain Genlock under certain uncommon Windows states
VX 3 servers now correctly map video capture inputs 11 and 12 to K and L when first configured
Keyframing a projection surface’s Render layer parameter via an Open layer now works properly
Unreal assets running via RenderStream will no longer report multiple errors when they have multiple levels and a level using texture parameters is not the first level represented in the Schema
Consoles now have improved logging about renewed licenses for easier debugging
Consoles will no longer be filled with irrelevant logging when running an RS workload without texture parameters

d3Service will now automatically check CodeMeter WebDepot for updated licenses and will update them for you. This will mean that monthly and yearly Pro subscriptions, as well as updates to expiry dates on any legacy licenses, will be updated automatically on your machine without you needing to manually activate a new license each time it renews. License update checks happen every 12 hours, and only if Designer is not running
Pressing the button Prepare to archive unused objects will now correctly identify props as in use
Applying feed settings on an IP-VFC card in SDI mode is now more reliable in some circumstances

Setting the Colour format field of a VFC slot to Auto or setting the enableColourFormat option switch to False will no longer always select a CVTRBv2 timing and will now correctly select the timing that best fits within the bandwidth available
Logs about expired licenses are now easier to understand
Designer now supports virtual spherical cameras
Spherical cameras now support backplate and frontplate mappings
Spherical cameras can now output 180 degree lat/long format (previously only 360° lat/long was supported)
Spherical cameras now have a button which allows you to toggle between a lat/long view and a spherical interactive view
Virtual cameras now highlight the field for the Live action position marker if it is not set
Fields that should not be set to None under normal operation are now highlighted in red when they are set to None to make them easy to spot
Spherical camera cube-map faces now have settable Padding and Overlap fields

Spherical mappings now have settable Padding and Overlap fields
The following improvements are unrelated to the xR for VR workflows but are still cool:
In d3Net Manager “Pro” range servers have been renamed to “VX” range
The term “d3” will now appear as “Designer” or “Disguise” in the EULA text
Improve performance of d3service when querying licenses (this should improve d3manager startup time in most cases)
System diagnostics now include a detailed summary of all CodeMeter Container details for easier troubleshooting
Designer now has a user-defined DPI scale which can be accessed under Project Settings > User Interface
Licenses will no longer be incorrectly reported as Perpetual in d3Manager in certain rare cases
RenderStream streaming to a spherical map now is rendered at the correct resolution instead of 36x higher than expected
2.5D assets from modern versions of Cuebric no longer load with unexpected depths between plates
EX range servers will no longer display NDI® video feeds in the wrong order in the Video Input Patch editor

Changing any Indirection will now wait to swap content for a few frames to allow for that content to be loaded. This means you should never see a flash to black when swapping a live indirection. We have also removed the Indirection delay (frames) field from indirection controllers as the correct delay is now computed automatically

The implementation of CEF and Chromium used in Disguise are now more modern. We now support CEF 132.3.2+g4997b2f and chromium 132.0.6834.161. This means you get more features, stability and performance in the following layers:

Web Layer
Text Layer

Content played on the timeline will now always load before the playhead jumps when jumping on the timeline. This will mean you should not see intermittent flashes to black or performance spikes when jumping on the timeline via the mouse, LTC or other transport control mechanism
Because Designer now prefetches content only when the jump command is issued, we have also significantly reduced the overhead of playing the normal timeline as Designer will no longer decode video frames from other parts of the track unnecessarily. This means that you should see performance improvements when entering new sections, jumping to new tracks or playing simple sections that lie just ahead of busy sections.
Video playback at speeds other than 1 or for videos with a higher content FPS than the timeline, now only decode the frames necessary for playback, improving performance in these states
The debug section for the prefetcher under ALT + D is now easier to read
The Find Usages button for media now displays the track, beat AND the Cue that the content is sequenced at if a cue exists
You can down define a set of environment variables to launch an RS asset under by placing a file named: assetname_variables.env next to the RS asset in the RenderStream Projects folder

FFMPEG has now been updated to 7.1 from 5.0.1. FFMPEG is used for:

Rendering Feed Movies
Rendering Stage Movies
Rendering Animation Movies
Uploading to Previs
These workflows will now be a bit faster and more stable
Mesh Mapping now has a new field called Render resolution scale which allows you to render the content at a higher or lower resolution than the mapping is resolution is warped to
The Find/Replace Usages button has moved to be above the “Hierarchy” tab for mappings
Mesh Mapping now has a new field called Render resolution scale which allows you to render the content at a higher or lower resolution than the mapping is resolution is warped to
The Find/Replace Usages button has moved to be above the “Hierarchy” tab for mappings
An additional graph is now available for each RenderStream texture parameter which displays the difference between request and receive time for each frame
Receiving tracking data over an extended period of time (5+ days) will no longer result in glitchy or jumpy tracking
3rd party tools can now correctly pick up the DNS-SD record published by d3service
Assets assigned to a bank/slot in a bank editor no longer appear in the “unused.txt” file when pressing the Prepare To Archive Unused Objects button
The remote status of Disguise servers in d3Manager’s Network tab is now more responsive when machines launch or close Designer
VFC cards that fail to initialise but are present will no longer be reported as missing
d3service will no longer intermittently fail to detect all IP-VFC cards if the cards were previously configured to a different FPS than the one currently configured in the Designer project

Using a Designer license to launch Designer on a Solo as an editor will no longer cause the Solo to initiate a count-down and quit the software due to licensing restrictions. (This will still happen if you try to use the server in other roles with its Solo license in versions after r30.0)
Setting the “Camera plate” setting of a spatial map to “Horizontal Back and Front Plates” setting will now work correctly again
Jumping to a timecode cue on a different track will no longer fail to jump if the time jumping to happens to be very close to the current playhead
Duplicating projectors will no longer cause an ACCESS_VIOLATION when certain GUI elements are open
System Diagnostics now include more detailed licensing logs for faster diagnostics
You can now copy and paste text in to the interactable window of web modules
Mousing over the software version in the bottom right of the Track widget now shows the full version of Designer in a tooltip
Editing a ClusterPool on one RenderStream layer on top of other RenderStream layers will no longer report spurious notifications
Reduced idle traffic sent over d3Net while RenderStream layers are under the Playhead
RenderStream layers will no longer report a spurious error and fail to update properly when the cluster assigner of a texture parameter is set to a non-default value
Long-clicking on a project in d3Manager will no longer open a rename box over the project name. You have to rename from explorer
After searching for a Cue in the Cue List and selecting it the GUI focus is now moved from the search box to the Track widget to enable faster, more intuitive programming

Various improvements to IP-VFC Colour Format behaviour:

Applying feeds on an IP-VFC will now attempt to apply the selected colour format and not force the output to RGB.
The feed outline will now correctly highlight in green when the colour format set in the GUI and the active output of the GPU match.
With the enableColourFormat option switch enabled Designer will no longer display a Sub Sampling option in the IP VFC GUI as it is now replaced with Colour Format.
Colour format options now specify in the GUI whether they are RGB or YCbCr to make it easier to select the correct format
Designer now correctly responds the POST indirections/set endpoint again. For information about our public APIs can be found here
Designer will no longer occasionally produce an Access Violation error when in OCIO mode and the input source to a layer changes from an Arrow source to a Texture
Actor machines are able to receive tracking data again

We have added a ‘Border expansion’ field In the Mapping editor for all geometric mapping types. This can be used when there is an empty space within the screen UV map to stop black pixels blurring into visible screen space. The units are pixels in pixels. The following mappings have this field:

Spherical
Perspective
Cylindrical
Camera Plate
Parallel
Mesh
The Shot Recording HTTP API has been updated to comply with the other V2 APIs. You can find more information about this by visiting our developer site here

You can now mix Green screen and LED screen objects in your MR sets, and camera calibration will work correctly on Luma-keyed inputs. Additionally:

Set extension will be applied outside of the LED screens and around any Luma-Keyed performers in front of Green screens.
We now only account for keying specifically within the green screen object so content being used by the LED screen with green in will no longer be keyed out
Designer will now log when a resource is set on a layer via HTTP sockpuppet within the console file to enable faster debugging
Our OCIO implementation has been updated to support v2.4! You can read more about OCIO 2.4 release here
Designer and d3Services API V2 endpoints are now discoverable via Windows DNS-SD. You can learn more about API discovery with DNS-SD here

You can now adjust output phase offset by lines and pixels in Designer with the option switches: genlockPhaseAdjustLines and genlockPhaseAdjustPixels. This is the same as setting a phase offset within the Nvidia or AMD interface, but will re-apply these settings during Apply Feed Settings
Designer will now include additional information from the Mellanox NIC (when present) within System Diagnostic package to enable faster debugging
Non-English keyboards can now reliably use Ctrl shortcuts
Projects with Tables will no longer hang when saving takes longer than expected
NatNet device recordings are no longer much larger than they need to be
The Remove Media API endpoint will no longer sometimes fail to delete the file from disk
Designer will no longer sometimes delete media from the disk on startup when the enableResourceDeletion option switch is enabled
XR calibrations now work when using a Luma keyed video input
Device recordings no longer load incorrectly when a track with same name as your current track is in the trash
Frame counters on the timeline will now be correct when Custom Timeline FPS is set to Global
RenderStream compressed streams will no longer fail to be received properly in very rare circumstances
Render machines are no longer shown as Offline on Editor machines
RenderStream streams from renderers using Vulkan (e.g. TouchDesigner) will no longer be out of sync when using Mesh Mappings
Versions in the version selector will no longer be coloured unless SLC is enabled
New tracks will no longer sometimes fail to appear in the tracks list until a project restart

Add support for HDMI & DP VFCs to output in 4:2:2 or 4:4:4
Setting HDMI and DisplayPort VFC cards to 4:2:2 or 4:4:4 is available behind the option switch enableColourFormat. It will stay behind the option switch until we are certain the EDID changes have no adverse downstream effects. The options available are RGB, RGB Limited, 4:4:4, 4:2:2, and Auto.
Auto Behaviour varies by VFC card:
IP -> Selects YUV 4:2:2
HDMI -> Selects RGB unless bandwidth Exceeds HDMI 2.0 spec at which point it will drop down to YUV 4:2:2
DP -> Selects RGB
DVI and SDI VFCs do not have this option. The colour format for DVI cards is always RGB (and that is all they support) and for SDI VFCs it is determined by the SMPTE standard format selected.
Select Colour Format

Designer now has the option to skip setting d3 projects share on installation. There is now an option during d3 installation to share the d3 projects folder. When it is ticked, the d3 projects folder is shared and Everyone is given read and write permissions (This is the current default behaviour). If it is un-ticked the user-configured sharing settings are not changed.
You can find more information about this feature here
Un-ticking this will mean that you can no longer access the shared folders via Manager and several features like content distribution won’t work unless you manually configure sharing settings.

Designer now has various ways of using the CTRL modified to interact with text fields. Here is a comprehensive list:

CTRL + Delete to delete the word to the right of the cursor
CTRL + Backspace to delete the word to the left of the cursor
CTRL + Left-click to move the cursor left to the next word boundary
CTRL + Right-click to move the cursor right to the next word boundary
CTRL + SHIFT + Left-click to extend the selection left to the next word boundary
CTRL + Shift + Right-click to extend the selection right to the next word boundary

Designer now supports full SDI HDR video capture and output via the Quad 3G VFC

Quad 3G VFC Cards now support super black/white luma with HDR transfer characteristics (HLG and PQ)

Designer will not allow the user to select HLG or PQ when outputting with Rec.709 or Rec.601
Dynamic range describes the ratio between the brightest and darkest parts of an image. High Dynamic Range (HDR) is a technology that represents an increased dynamic range in an image to provide a greater level of contrast, brightness and colour.
Both Hybrid Log-Gamma (HLG) and Perceptual Quantiser (PQ) transfer functions for HDR video are supported for SDI HDR capture.
We now support HDR video capture on all Disguise media servers with SDI capture cards. For the signal to be captured properly as HDR it must be:
In the REC.2020 (also known as BT.2020) colour space
Set to 10-bit
In the Video Input Patch Editor, the Input Transform needs to be changed to HLG - Rec.2020 or PQ - Rec.2020. The format field will then show the colorimetry and transfer characteristics as seen in the screenshot below:
We also support SDI HDR video output using the Quad 3G VFC card. In the Feed View we have added the option to change the YCbCr Conversion Matrix to Rec.2020 (BT.2020). The Transfer Characteristics setting will then need to be changed to either HLG or PQ depending on the transfer function being used.

Support non-16:9 camera aspect ratios with “region of interest”

Video input configuration now supports the ability to crop the image with two new configuration fields:
Crop size: The crop rectangle size in pixels to apply to the incoming video. The applied crop will be centered on the frame e.g. a horizontal crop of 1600px on a 1920px original frame will remove 160px on the left-hand side and 160px on the right hand side.
Crop offset: The offset in pixels to apply to the crop rectangle. Offsetting the crop rectangle more than half the crop size in an axis will cause the crop rectangle to shrink in order to stay within the original frame.
This functionality is useful for use cases such as when a camera produces non-16:9 output over SDI which is restricted to 16:9, resulting in black bars. The black bars can be cropped out with this feature. Productions using anamorphic lenses will also benefit from this feature.
For more information about video in cropping, see setup-video-input

ProRes Support
ProRes video codecs are now supported for playout on Disguise. ProRes is a visually lossless codec that uses intra-frame compression, where each frame is stored independently and can be decoded with no dependencies on other frames.
Users are now able to playout the following ProRes codecs from Disguise
ProRes 422
ProRes 422 HQ
ProRes 422 LT
ProRes 422 Proxy
ProRes 4444
ProRes 4444 XQ
ProRes RAW playback in Disguise is not supported.
ProRes video codecs are CPU-based. We recommend checking the video playback performance for the Disguise media server(s) when deciding whether ProRes is appropriate for your show or production.

Export proﬁles of GPU memory allocation
We have added proﬁleGPUPoolFromLaunch as an option switch to enable users to trigger the creation of a memory proﬁle so that they can understand the behaviour of a GPU pool for debugging purposes. This is exported as a .json ﬁle to a project folder called ‘output’.

In r27.5.1 we introduced DSOF-26887, which added GUI status to the ‘Output’ indicator on the Network Status Widget. The GUI icon follows the same convention as the other icons, namely if the GUI is on a Disguise media server running in session that the icon will be green. If it is off then the icon will be grey. The icon became orange if the GUI was on the understudy machines running in session.

Custom colour primaries in Gamma Space mode
We have added the option to add custom output colour primaries from Designer to enable high performance colour transforms for LED panels. This is available when Gamma Space mode is selected as the colour management mode in Project Settings. This can be found by right-clicking an LED Screen found in a project and right-clicking Colour Profile underneath the Output dropdown menu.

Implement colour management interface with Notch version 1.0
We now support colour management settings included in a Notch block exported from version 1.0 or later to a Notch layer in Designer.

Raise warning about Notch version 1.0 compatibility on unsupported servers
Notch Blocks that have been exported in version 1.0 or later have a number of requirements in order to run on a Disguise media server:
Windows OS: must be Windows 10 1607 or higher
GPU: support for Nvidia GPUs only (Maxwell Architecture or later)
Notch Blocks that are exported in version 1.1 or later will have the following requirements in order to run on a Disguise media server:
Windows OS: must be Windows 10 1607 or higher
GPU: support for Nvidia GPUs only (Turing Architecture or later)
We have created a notification in Designer to warn a user that attempts to run a Notch block that has been exported in version 1.0 or later on a Disguise media server that is not supported.
A compatibility table can be found here
More information about Notch layers can be found here.
